Api¶

Admin Object¶

class admin.Admin(app, url_prefix='/admin', main_dashboard=<dashboard.Dashboard instance at 0x36a1b48>, blue_print=<flask.blueprints.Blueprint object at 0x369ca90>)[source]¶

Class that provides a way to add admin interface to Flask applications.

navigation[source]¶

Returns main navigation elements as nested dict.

register_module(module_class, rule, endpoint, short_title, title=None, parent=None)[source]¶

Registers new module to current admin.

Admin Modules¶

admin.recursive_getattr(obj, attr)[source]¶

Returns object related attributes, as it’s a template filter None is return when attribute doesn’t exists.

eg:

a = object()
a.b = object()
a.b.c = 1
recursive_getattr(a, 'b.c') => 1
recursive_getattr(a, 'b.d') => None
class admin.AdminNode(admin, endpoint, short_title, title=None)[source]¶

An AdminNode just act as navigation container, it doesn’t provide any rules.

class admin.AdminModule(admin, url_prefix, endpoint, short_title, title)[source]¶

Class that provides a way to create simple admin module.

  • endpoint – the endpoint
  • view_func – the view
register_rules()[source]¶

  • order_by_name – the field name to order by
  • order_by_direction – the field direction
  • offset – the offset position
  • limit – the limit
